page.title: 02VIEWS OF INHABITANTS
page.content: Inhabitants enjoy living in the villages although they work elsewhere. More community spirit and meeting places would be welcomed but most people are too busy to put energy into such projects. In Woodeaton the need for control of traffic i.e. in terms of numbers and weights of vehicles and their speed is recognised. A speed limit of 30 m.p.h. together with street lighting is felt necessary. The farming community don't like the Common Agricultural Policy dictated by the European Economic Community.Arable farming is more profitable than keeping livestock. Most houses have a telephone and there is a public phone box in Elsfield but not in Woodeaton.All three villages have a post box.Mail is collected and delivered every weekday.
